Contact us

Name *
Name
Thank you!

item.title: About us
item.content:encoded:
About us

We love film here at Tinygiantz, especially short films. Because we understand the amount of skill it takes to tell a great story in a short amount of time. We also know that a lot of great short films get drowned out by other video content on popular video sites after getting uploaded. Because of this, we at Tinygiantz have created a space that is updated frequently and where these great films can be easily found and enjoyed without being drowned out.

No filmmaker has to pay to be seen on Tinygiantz, you just have to tell an interesting story.

item.title: Fish Heads
item.content:encoded:
A black comedy about a gang of beginners who gets in trouble planning a heist.

item.title: Market Hours
item.content:encoded:
Randall spends his days imagining the vibrant inner lives of various vendors at the multicultural urban market where he works; none more so than Angela, an angel with her own pastry shop. But Randall’s inattention to his work has lead to a string of thefts and soon threatens to cost him his job. A chance encounter with a beautiful starlet and her lapdog provides Randall not only an opportunity to break the ice with Angela, but a chance to prove his worth to everyone at the market ­ including himself.
Director:Jon Goldman
Producer:Joey Horvitz, Marc Longberg
Screenplay:Jon Goldman
DoP:James Whitaker
Cast:Leonard Earl Howze, Hong Chau, Ajay Mehta, Elizabeth de Razzo, Ashlynn Yennie, Trevor Fraker
Year:2014
Trivia:According to the director the inspiration for this film was the works of Wong Kar-Wai.

item.title: Je T’Aime John Wayne
item.content:encoded:
Belmonde lives in 1990's London as an iconic, cool Frenchman modelled on the new wave cinema of the 1960's. In reality he is English and middle class - a fact that his family won't let him forget.
Director:Toby MacDonald
Producer:Luke Morris
Screenplay:Luke Ponte
DoP:Nic Knowland
Cast:Kris Marshall, Camilla Rutherford, Laura Lumley, Mark Rex, Martin Dawson
Year:2000
Trivia:Winner of the Best Short Film Award at the European Film Awards 2001.
The film pays homage to the Jean-Luc Godard film “À bout de soufflé” (“Breathless”) from 1960 starring Jean-Paul Belmondo and Jean Seberg.
The movie’s scriptwriter Luke Ponte has described the film as being about "an Englishman who thinks he's a Frenchman who thinks he's an American."
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

Screenplay:Stéphane Paccolat
DoP:Computer

Festvial ASIFA Golden Award

item.title: Carousel
item.content:encoded:
An armoured van heist gone wrong, robbers dressed in clown masks fight with police officers inside a hospital in this intense action movie where time stands still.
Director:Adam Berg
Producer:John Reardon, Jeroen Jedeloo, Iwona Echt
Screenplay:Adam Berg
DoP:Fredrik Bäckar
Year:2009
Trivia:Winner of the advertising industry's most prestigious award: the Grand Prix at the Cannes Lions International Advertising Festival.
Scenes from Carousel were used in the music video for hip hop artist 50 Cent's single "Ok, You're Right".
Adam Berg is the brother of Joakim Berg, the lead singer of the rock band Kent, and has directed almost all of the band’s music videos.

item.title: Jesus Fish
item.content:encoded:
On the shores of "Tennessee's only bio-luminescent lake", the line between myth and reality is blurred. Would-be con artist, Timothy West, will walk this line, improvising one elaborate scheme after another to keep the money he stole from the church and pass himself off as a repentant miracle worker. With his adopted brother, Light, reluctantly at his side, Timothy seems bound to make a clean getaway, unless a certain legend turns out to be real.
Director:Bryce James McGuire
Producer:Colton Davie
Screenplay:Bryce James McGuire
DoP:Colton Davie
Cast:Tomas Pais, Uland Cunningham, Cheyenne Walker, Tony McCuiston, Lesley Warren
Year:2013
Trivia:The film premiered at the 2013 Indie Grits Festival.
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

Filmed on 16mm film.

item.title: A Warrior's Dream

item.title: Luxo Jr.
item.content:encoded:
A baby lamp finds a ball to play with and it's all fun and games until the ball bursts. Just when the elder Luxo thinks his kid will settle down for a bit, Luxo Jr. finds another ball—ten times larger.
Director:John Lasseter
Producer:John Lasseter, William Reeves
Screenplay:John Lasseter
DoP:Computer
Cast:Luxo Jr., Luxo Sr.
Year:1986
Trivia:This is Pixar Animation Studios first film.
The small lamp in this film became Pixar's logo.
The first computer-animated short nominated for an Academy Award.
The bouncing ball in this short has cameo appearances in several Pixar features. In Toy Story (1995), In Upp (2009), it is in the apartment where the girl plays as Carl's house floats past her window. In Monsters, Inc. (2001) it is in Boo's room. Also, in Toy Story the larger ball chases Buzz Lightyear in an Indiana Jones homage.

Year:2005
Trivia:Jamin Winans discovered Jonny Hayz II at a hip hop show. Listening to Hayz motivated him to go home and write Spin. The movie was released online in 2005 (before YouTube) to an email list of 1,000 people. Within 48 hours, it shut down the Double Edge Films website server due to the traffic. Over the next year it won over 45 festival awards and screened in over 80 festivals.

item.title: Inside
item.content:encoded:
A riveting story about a man whose incarceration in an asylum is up for review.
Director: Trevor Sands
Producer: Gary Bryman, Steve Hein
Screenplay: Eric 'Giz' Gewirtz, Trevor Sands
DoP: Eric Haase
Cast: Jeremy Sisto, Reedy Gibbs, Michael Bailey Smith, Alexandra Brandl, Michael Cornacchia, Megahn Perry
Year: 2002
Trivia: Winner of the Best Short Film Award at San Diego Film Festival 2002. Won the Golden Gate Award for Film & Video – Short Narrative at the San Francisco International Film Festival 2002.
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

item.title: Iconic - Moonbootica
item.content:encoded:
A sweet love story in a rough and violent environment full of guns and drugs.
Director: David Hache, Marc-Edouard Leon
Producer: Jason Baum
Screenplay: David Hache, Marc-Edouard Leon
DoP: Larkin Seiple
Cast:
Year: 2012
Trivia: Nominated for a UK Music Video Award for Best International Dance Video 2012.

item.title: The Bear
item.content:encoded:
A fun and personal introduction to the unique director Paul Bearman.
Director: Matthijs Van Heijningen
Producer: Yuki Suga
Screenplay: Jean-Christophe Royer, Eric Astorgue
DoP: Joost Van Gelder
Cast:
Year: 2011
Trivia: This film has won numerous awards, including the Grand Prix Film Craft Award at the 2012 Cannes Lions Advertising Festival, where it also won three Gold Lions and a Silver Lion. It is the world’s most awarded TV ad ever.
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

item.title: Cinema - the Fictitious World
item.content:encoded:
A small boy…in a small Bangladeshi village. Harbouring dreams of becoming an actor; entertaining millions through the magic of cinema. His father, a projectionist in the local cinema, encourages him to follow his dreams.
Director: Asif Islam
Producer: Lucilia Fernandes, Andrew Panayi
Screenplay: Faisal Roddy
DoP: Asif Islam
Cast: Selim Sultan, Sujon, Sushoma, Alam Khan
Year: 2011
Trivia: Shot on 5D mark 2.
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

item.title: Signs
item.content:encoded:
Where do you find love? Sometimes all you need is a sign.
Director: Patrick Hughes
Producer: Victoria Conners Bell
Screenplay: Patrick Hughes, Karl Fleet, Nick Worthington
DoP: Cameron Barnett
Cast: Nick Russell, Kestie Morassi
Year: 2008
Trivia: Winner of the Cannes Gold Lion Award at the Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity 2009.
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

item.title: Unlocking The Truth - Malcolm Brickhouse & Jarad Dawkins
item.content:encoded:
These sixth-grade metalheads from Flatbush, Brooklyn are on a mission to rock your socks off.
Director: Luke Meyer
Producer: Julia Wilczok, Tom Davis
Screenplay: Luke Meyer
DoP: Hillary Spera
Cast: Malcolm Brickhouse, Jarad Dawkins
Year: 2013
Trivia: Official Selection at Jecheon International Music & Film Festival 2014. The band has since the film was released signed a contract with Sony Music.
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

item.title: The Gift
item.content:encoded:
A messenger delivers a mysterious box to a wealthy man.
Director: Carl Rinsch
Producer: Margo Mars
Screenplay: Carl Rinsch
DoP: Roman Vasyanov
Cast: Uday Chandra, Rishabh Sharma
Year: 2010
Trivia: Awarded a Gold Medal in the Sound Design category at the International Advertising Awards 2011. Won the Special Recognition Award at LA Shorts Fest 2010. Carl Rinsch was after the success of this short film chosen to direct the Hollywood blockbuster 47 Ronin with Keanu Reeves in the lead.
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

item.title: attachment-539b0f70e4b0f872cec1c6f1
item.content:encoded: img-539b0f70e4b0f872cec1c6f1
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

item.title: Tussilago
item.content:encoded:
Norbert Kröcher was arrested on March 31, 1977. He was leading a group planning to kidnap Swedish politician Anna-Greta Leijon. A number of suspects were arrested in the days following. One of them was Kröcher's ex-girlfriend, "A". This is her story.
Director: Jonas Odell
Producer: Linda Hambäck, Niklas Adolfsson
Screenplay: Linda Hambäck, Niklas Adolfsson
DoP: Per Helin
Cast: Malin Buska, Camaron Silverek, Fredrik Wagner
Year: 2010
Trivia: Winner of the Guldbagge Award for best short film. Best short film winner at Hot Docs Canadian International Documentary Festival.
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

item.title: attachment-5319e45de4b0ee73efefb2f9
item.content:encoded: img-5319e45de4b0ee73efefb2f9
item.dc:creator: kims.second@gmail.com

item.title: TROOPS
item.content:encoded:
TROOPS is filmed on location with the men of the Imperial Forces. All suspects are guilty--period! Otherwise, they wouldn't be suspects, would they?
Director: Kevin Rubio
Producer: Kevin Rubio, Shant Jordan, Patrick Pérez
Screenplay: Kevin Rubio, Steven Melching, David Hargrove, David McDermott
DoP: Cricket Peters
Cast: Cameron Clarke, Jess Harnell, Eric Hilleary, Caleb Skinner
Year: 1997
Trivia: TROOPS jump-started the modern fan film movement, as it was one of the first short films to bring fan films into the digital age, taking advantage of internet distribution and affordable production and special effects equipment, as well as fans with movie-quality costumes. George Lucas, upon seeing the film, was so impressed he declared that the movie was really "lost footage from Star Wars". The film was awarded the inaugural Pioneer Award at the Lucasfilm-sponsored 2002 Official Star Wars Fan Film Awards.
item.dc:creator: square@tinygiantz.com

item.title: The Lunch Date
item.content:encoded:
A woman misses her train and buys lunch in a café. When she returns to her table, a man is eating her salad.
Director: Adam Davidson
Co-producer: Garth Stein
Screenplay: Adam Davidson
DoP: Anghel Deca
Cast: Scotty Bloch, Clebert Ford, Bernard Johnson, Paul Sarnoff
Year: 1989
Trivia: Winner of the Short Film Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival and an Academy Award for Best Short Film. In 2013 the film was selected for preservation in the United States National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as being "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant".
item.dc:creator: square@tinygiantz.com
